section.p: In order to get Torque to generate the right Scarab .sql files for Postgresql and to allow Scarab to connect to Postgres, please try the following directions:

ol.li: Create a scarab/build.properties file. There are instructions in the SCARAB/README.txt file which detail why you want to do this.
In the build.properties file, fill out the following properties with the right information pertaining to Postgresql (see below for examples). Then, remove the target directory and rebuild.

One should also follow the directions for setting up Postgresql to accept TCP/IP connections from localhost.
scarab.database.name=scarab
scarab.database.port=5432
scarab.database.host=localhost
scarab.database.url=jdbc:postgresql://${scarab.database.host}:${scarab.database.port}/${scarab.database.name}
scarab.database.admin.url=jdbc:postgresql://${scarab.database.host}:${scarab.database.port}/
scarab.database.type=postgresql
scarab.database.jdbc.driver=org.postgresql.Driver
scarab.database.username=[INSERT_USERNAME_HERE]
scarab.database.password=

Use the scarab/src/sql/create-db.sh script to create and populate the database. For example:
cd scarab/src/sql ./create-db.sh [arguments]
To get a list of arguments that the create-db.sh script accepts, one can just execute ./create-db.sh --help
